title: Computer Shopper - October 2016 (gnv64)
description:
Computer Shopper - October 2016
English | 140 pages | PDF | 37.2 mb

Regulars
6 Letters - Your regular monthiy missives of wit and yrfsdom, tips and tricks
10 Under Development - When an old customer with a reluctance to pay his bills comes calling for helft ?avid Robinson can't resist a touch of schadenfreude
12 Cybercop - The ma)ware of choice for the discerning cybercriminal these days is ransomware: it's lucrative, simple and almost impossible to trace, Gordon Holmes asks if the security industry should be doing more to combat it
14 Rants & Raves - With its low taxes, close links to the UK, US and EU, and the black stuff on tap, there's only one place to be if you're in II Mel Croucher celebrates the luck of the Irish
138 Zygote - He may not be able to sniff out digital porn like a well-trained labrador, but Zygote still has an eye for a story. Unfortunately, thanks to his nocturnal tiabits with a smartphone, it is only one eye

Features
106 Rise of the Robots - No longer the preserve of dystopian sci-fi, robots are an increasingly common part of everyday life; We look an he good, the bad -and reveal the best bots you can buy today
116 Everything is Connected - Imagine a world where everything is connected to the internet, from your fridge to your body parts. Well, thanks to the Internet of Things, that day is rapidly approach

News
All the latest news and views from the technology world, inctuding;
16 Need to Know - The Pok^mon Go craze hits the streets
20 Globe Trotting - The latest tech news from around the world
21 The Lowdown - A layman's guide to quantum computing
22 From the Lab - We explore the world of science and space
23 Retro: The Atari 2 GOO - The console that kickstarted modern gaming
24 Make the Future London - High-tech innovations in energy conservation

Learn
124 Business - Help Our export answers your software queries
126 Helpfile - Your hardware and Windows problems solved
126 Multimedia Expert - You don't need Photoshop and a powerful PC to edit photos these days. Ben Pitt looks at the mobile apps to improv/e your snaps on the go
134 Advanced Projects - Give Webster shows you how you can build a fully functioning robot with the kids for less than Â£30

Reviews
26 This month's hot product - Chill blast's Â£900 Fusion Everest PC gives us our first look at the AMD Radeon RX 430, a mid-range graphics card with surprising4K and VR capability
28 PCs and Laptops - The near-silent, water-cooled PC Specialist Liquid Series is outpaced by Palicomp's 17 Predator (p30)
32 Handheld - At Â£329, the OnePlus 3 (p33) is yet another affordable rival to the likes of Samsung, LG ane HTCs top flagships
38 Photography - The Canon G7 X Mark II is a superb CSC with a tilting touchscreen and quality Tin sensor that can compete wtth full DSLRs
41 Displays - It's not ideal for games, but the liyama ProLite XUS3490WQSU's 21:9 aspect ratio and huge 34-in panel means it excels at multitasking
44 Home Cinema - Samsung's UES5KS7500 is a slick UHD TV with excellent backlighting and contrast, although you can get even better image quality elsewhere
46 Audio - Enjoy your music undisturbed with the Bose QuietComforr 35 headphones (p4fi) and their active noise cancelling
49 Printers - The Samsung ProXpress C30S0FR is a multifunction peripheral that's cheap to run but expensive to buy in the first place
52 Networks - Fast in operation and easy to set up, the new Smart Hub is BT's best router yet
54 Storage - Photographers rejoice - the WD My Passport Wireless Pro works great with hefty files, both wired and over a network
56 Components - Asus makes the best gaming graphics card even better with the overclocked, triple-fan-cooled ROG Strix GTX1080 OC
58 Games - A confident reboot of the 2008 cult hit, Mirror's Edge Catalyst (p59) is free-running, free-roaming fun
60 Best Buys - Looking for the best kit we've reviewed recently? It's all in our Best Buys section
76 How We Test - Our tests, ratings and awards explained
78 Your Software - Bring your lost files back from the dead with the full version of Auslogics File Recovery 6

Group Tests 
84 Laptops - Whether you're looking for a budget Windows 10 laptop or 2-in-1, a portable gaming powerhouse Or a stylish ultra-portable, we've got you covered with our megatest of 22 laptops from just Â£160
100 Drones - We take to the skies with our first-ever group test of unmanned aircraft, with everything from fun models costing less than Â£20 to top-of-the-range drones for photographers. Chocks away!
